meanings.definition: To carry or drag with effort or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: I had to shlep all the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She always shleps her heavy backpack up the stairs after school.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, he had to shlep his tired body to the gym.
meanings.sent4: The weight of her worries felt like a heavy burden she had to shlep everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to shlep his gear through the dense jungle, fighting against the thick foliage.

meanings.definition: To move or go slowly or laboriously.
meanings.sent1: The old dog likes to shlep around the yard, taking his time to sniff everything.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker began to shlep up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The snail seemed to shlep along at its own leisurely pace, unaffected by the rushing world.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to shlep by as she waited for the bus in the pouring rain.
meanings.sent5: The heavy fog made everything appear to shlep along in slow motion, creating a dreamlike atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Cleaning out the garage was such a shlep, but it had to be done.
meanings.sent2: He considered mowing the lawn in the scorching heat a real shlep.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending paperwork on his desk felt like a never-ending shlep.
meanings.sent4: Trying to fix the broken sink turned into a shlep that lasted all weekend.
meanings.sent5: The annual inventory count at the store was always a massive shlep, requiring hours of hard work.
